page.title: 07Houses in Elton
page.content: The houses are almost all built of local gritstone. Many of the older houses in the centre of the village were built in the 17C. and 18c. during the leadmining era. Dwelling and farm- houses cluster together along the spring-line between the gritstone and limestone. Former shops, workshops, the Smithy etc. can still be seen on Main Street now used as garages. In recent years new building has been restricted to infilling. There are some Council houses. Many houses have solid fuel central-heating and many retain open fires. Electricity is connected but not gas. During the past 15 years there has been an increased demand for houses from people prepared to commute from Matlock, Bakewell and Chesterfield and prices have increased tenfold.
